alert.note: Alert for Northern Washoe County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 11 at 1:35PM PDT until October 12 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM PDT THURSDAY... * CHANGES...Upgraded the Freeze Watch to a Warning. * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 degrees expected. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties, Northern Washoe County and Surprise Valley California. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 8 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Elevations less than 6000 feet across northeast California are expected to dip into the low 20s for 4-6 hours late tonight into Thursday morning. Surprise Valley and northern Washoe County are expected to get down to 28-32 degrees.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
